intro: Scandix infesta, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Scandix infesta is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. It has been used traditionally in some cultures for its medicinal properties.
